item.title: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of $2$ in Statistics
item.description: First off, this is a reference to The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics in the Natural Sciences , a very popular paper by Eugene Wigner which explores how mathematics is unreasonably effective at not only explaining, but also predicting scientific phenomena. I had a similar question about the number $2$ which repeatedly shows up in engineering and science, specifically in the form of the $2$-norm of a vector, and seems surprisingly effective at doing what it’s supposed to do.
